de.ovgu.softwareprojektapp.sensors

Class AbstractSensor

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ovgu.softwareprojektapp.sensors.AbstractSensor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.hardware.SensorEventListener, DataSource
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Accelerometer, AmbientTemperature, GameRotationVector, Gravity, Gyroscope, GyroscopeUncalibrated, Light, LinearAcceleration, MagneticField, MagneticFieldUncalibrated, Orientation, Pressure, Proximity, RelativeHumidity, RotationVector

    public abstract class AbstractSensor
extends java.lang.Object
implements DataSource, android.hardware.SensorEventListener
    Super class for our sensors as much of the work is the same for any sensor type

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean mListenerRegistered
      True if we already have registered as a sensor listener
      private SensorType mPsychicSensorType
      Since we have our own definition of sensor type (android definitions not available in common), we want to save that, too
      private android.hardware.SensorManager mSensorManager
      The android sensor manager used to connect to the accelerometer
      private int mSensorType
      What sensor type this sensor should listen to
      private DataSink mSink
      The sink data should be pushed into

      Create a new sensor object; does not start anything yet, use start() or setRunning(boolean) to start receiving events

        sensorType - sensor type we should register for

      • translateSensorSpeed

        private int translateSensorSpeed(SetSensorSpeed.SensorSpeed sensorSpeed)
        Translate the sensor speed from SetSensorSpeed.SensorSpeed to Androids integer constants
        Parameters:
        sensorSpeed - the sensor speed that should be translated
        Returns:
        an int representing the given sensor speed, like SensorManager.SENSOR_DELAY_WHATEVER

      • setSensorSpeed

        public abstract void setSensorSpeed(SetSensorSpeed.SensorSpeed targetSpeed)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Changes the frequency of this sensor. Because this has to re-register the listener, a slight delay might be experienced. The sensor speed variable should be static, so that setting the sensor speed in one instance sets it for all instances of the given sensor.
        Parameters:
        targetSpeed - the speed the sensor should run at after this call
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when the sensor could not be restarted

      • getSensorSpeed

        public abstract SetSensorSpeed.SensorSpeed getSensorSpeed()
        This function must give the current sensor speed set for the sensor. As the sensor speed must be static, the sensor speed should be the same for all sensor instances
        Returns:
        static sensor speed for the sensor.

      • getRange

        public float getRange()
        Get the range of the sensor as reported by android
        Returns:
        0 if the sensor does not exist, or the range

      • close

        public void close()
        Unregister sensor listener
        Specified by:
        close in interface DataSource

      • isRegistered

        public boolean isRegistered()
        Get the state of listener registration
        Returns:
        true if the listener is currently registered

      • getSensorType

        SensorType getSensorType()
        Returns the sensor type the implementation deals with
